intro: Cyphostemma gracillimum, commonly known as the slender cyphostemma, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its thin, twining stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by red, fleshy fruits that are edible for some animals. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in shrublands and coastal areas. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
